column1: It is also pertinent to refer to the Supreme Court case of Amarasekera vs.

column2: Jayanetti 64 CLW  17 where T.S.  Fernando J. held thus,
"The question that arises upon this appeal is whether an alienation
of land executed,  during a  lucid interval by a  person who has been

column3: to  be  of  unsound  mind  and

column2: incapable  of  managing  his  affairs,  void  where  the  execution  has
taken place while the adjudication remains unreserved."
